remarks: Deduce a group from its properties.  In this version of ~ isgrpd2 , we don't assume there is an expression for the inverse of ` x ` . (Contributed by NM, 10-Aug-2013.)
statement:
isgrpd2.b $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` G ) ) $.
isgrpd2.p $e |- ( ph -> .+ = ( +g ` G ) ) $.
isgrpd2.z $e |- ( ph -> .0. = ( 0g ` G ) ) $.
isgrpd2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. Mnd ) $.
isgrpd2e.n $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> E. y e. B ( y .+ x ) = .0. ) $.
isgrpd2e $p |- ( ph -> G e. Grp ) $.
$d .+ x y $.
$d .0. y $.
$d B x y $.
$d G x y $.
$d ph x y $.
